bioghist.p: The Pennsylvania Ballet was established in 1963 by Barbara Weisberger through a Ford Foundation initiative to develop regional professional dance companies. The company performed in the national spotlight for the first time in 1968 at City Center in New York, a highly successful debut that led to a decade of national touring, appearances on PBS' acclaimed Dance in America series, and a stint as the official company of the Brooklyn Academy of Music during the 1970s. From 1987 to 1989, Pennsylvania Ballet forged an alliance with Milwaukee Ballet in an unprecedented venture to create one company. The new organization, with 43 dancers and a greatly expanded repertoire, was the first in the country to offer its dancers year-round employment. The premier classical ballet company in the Philadelphia region, Pennsylvania Ballet is currently comprised of 42 dancers. During the Company's 40-year history, it has commissioned original ballets from such choreographers as Merce Cunningham, Christopher d'Amboise, Trey McIntyre, Matthew Neenan, Kevin O'Day, David Parsons, Val Caniparoli, Christopher Stowell, Dwight Rhoden, Meredith Rainey, Kirk Peterson, and Lynne Taylor-Corbett, as well as the 40th Anniversary commission of Swan Lake by Christopher Wheeldon.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Pennsylvania Ballet Company. The collection comprises publicity materials and office records. Publicity materials include: season programs, playbills, posters, and announcements; scrapbooks of press clippings; and photographs and slides of dancers and productions; materials related to radio and television publicity; and press releases. Office records include copies of memoranda and fundraising records of the board of trustees; corporate donor lists; income statements; contracts and agreements with dancers and choreographers; biographical information on and photographs of corps members and guest artists; tour information, such as itineraries, schedules, and promotional materials; copies of Dance Magazine and other publications; and videos of PA Ballet dance performances. Names appearing in office files include Barbara Weisberger, Artistic Director, Robert Altman, Managing Director, and Benjamin Harkarvy, Associate Artistic Director. The collection also includes a costume jacket.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
